meanings.definition: To move one's hand or an object back and forth against a surface.
meanings.sent1: I rub the table to clean off the dust.
meanings.sent2: She likes to rub her hands together when she's nervous.
meanings.sent3: The cat tried to rub against the wall, thinking it was a scratching post.
meanings.sent4: His words seemed to rub against her beliefs, causing tension.
meanings.sent5: The rough fabric made the action of rubbing very uncomfortable.

meanings.definition: To apply pressure and friction to a part of the body.
meanings.sent1: Mom will rub my back until I fall asleep.
meanings.sent2: After a long day, I like to rub my sore feet.
meanings.sent3: He tried to rub away the pain, but it only made it worse.
meanings.sent4: The massage therapist can rub out the knots in your muscles.
meanings.sent5: The warmth of her hands as she rubbed my shoulders was soothing.

meanings.definition: A substance used for rubbing, such as a liniment or ointment.
meanings.sent1: The doctor applied the rub to my sprained ankle.
meanings.sent2: I always keep a muscle rub in my gym bag.
meanings.sent3: The spicy rub smelled like cinnamon and cloves.
meanings.sent4: The rub provided instant relief to his aching joints.
meanings.sent5: The herbal rub had a cooling effect on his sunburn.
